summary: This document is a forensic timeline analysis of computer activity from two Bureau of Prisons (BOP) workstations on August 9-10, 2019, the night before and morning of Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details user logins, document access, and web browsing, including searches related to Epstein and other inmates.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: User of BOP workstation (Device 1) with username BOP19012. Activity includes accessing SHU (Special Housing Unit) documents and browsing motorcycle sales sites.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: User of BOP workstation (Device 2) with username BOP61232. Activity includes searching for 'latest on epstein in Jail', accessing news articles about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and searching for other inmates like Omar Amanat.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of news articles searched for by Tova Noel. The searches occur on August 10, 2019, the day of his death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in a CNBC article about released documents, which was accessed by Tova Noel during her web browsing.

persons.name: Omar Amanat
persons.context: Subject of multiple Google searches by Tova Noel, who also accessed his sentencing memorandum PDF from the Department of Justice website.

persons.name: Kenyatta Taiste
persons.context: Subject of multiple Google searches by Tova Noel, with searches for variations like 'KENYATTA TAISTE' and 'KENYATTA KHAN'.

connections.description: Noel, a BOP employee, conducted web searches for 'latest on epstein in Jail' on the morning of August 10, 2019.
Both are named together in a CNBC article about released documents that Tova Noel accessed.
Noel conducted multiple Google searches for 'latest on omar amanat' and accessed his sentencing memorandum.

events.title: Tova Noel Computer Login and Browsing
events.description: Tova Noel logs into her BOP workstation, accesses VA benefits sites, and browses furniture and insurance websites.

events.title: Michael Thomas Accesses SHU Documents
events.description: Michael Thomas logs into his BOP workstation and accesses, saves, and prints multiple documents related to Special Housing Unit (SHU) rules and locator sheets at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York.

events.title: Tova Noel Searches for Epstein News
events.description: Tova Noel conducts Google searches for 'latest on epstein in Jail' and accesses a CNBC article about documents released regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Tova Noel Searches for Other Inmates
events.description: Tova Noel conducts searches for 'KENYATTA TAISTE' and 'latest on omar amanat', accessing related news articles and legal documents.

keyFacts: The forensic analysis covers computer activity on August 9-10, 2019, the night before and morning of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
BOP employee Tova Noel searched for 'latest on epstein in Jail' and accessed a CNBC article about Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell on the morning of August 10, 2019.
BOP employee Michael Thomas accessed and printed documents related to Special Housing Unit (SHU) rules and procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York.
Tova Noel also conducted web searches for other individuals, including federal inmate Omar Amanat and a person named Kenyatta Taiste/Khan.
The user activity logs show periods of inactivity and system locks, creating a timeline of staff computer use during a critical period.
